snippet: The comments by members of the Afghan delegation added to speculation that there was a widening rift among the Taliban’s leadership over the peace process.
abstract: Afghan officials declare that initial talks with Taliban insurgents in Pakistan were authorized by Taliban's deputy leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour; comments add to conjecture there are growing differences among Taliban leaders over desirability of attempts to negotiate peace in Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: The comments by members of the Afghan delegation added to speculation that there was a widening rift among the Taliban’s leadership over the peace process.

headline.main: Taliban Were Authorized to Talk, Afghan Envoys Say
headline.print_headline: Kabul Says Taliban Were Authorized to Talk
